title: In Hearing Transcript, Jack Smith Defends Decision to Indict Trump
summary: The former special counsel accused President Trump of “exploiting” violence on Jan. 6, 2021, according to an interview released by House Republicans.

title: Trump Vetoes 2 Bills, Drawing Accusations of Retaliation
summary: The president said he blocked the bills to save taxpayers’ money. But he has grievances against a tribe in Florida and officials in Colorado.

title: Trump’s Veto of Water Project Is His Latest Targeted Hit on Colorado
summary: The president seems to be at war with the Democratic-led state as he raises the pressure on Colorado leaders to release a convicted election denier, Tina Peters, from state prison.

title: Mamdani Reverses Call to End Mayoral Control of NYC Public Schools
summary: The mayor-elect’s turnaround came as he selected Kamar Samuels to lead New York City’s school system at a precarious moment.

title: On His Last Day, Adams Drops From View but Still Flexes His Muscle
summary: Mayor Eric Adams had one public appearance on his schedule, but that didn’t stop him from naming a third charter commission in the last hours of his administration.

title: Mamdani’s Man-of-the-People Style Could Present Security Challenges
summary: Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani, gregarious with constituents and vilified by a range of critics, is taking office at a time of anxiety about political violence.

title: Mamdani Names Top Deputies for Child Care, Operations and Climate
summary: Zohran Mamdani, the mayor-elect, announced several key appointments who could help implement central promises of his agenda, including universal child care.

title: New Year’s 2026 Celebrations Around the World: Photos and Videos
summary: See how people across the globe celebrated.

title: New Year’s Eve Crowds Brave Cold at NYC’s Times Square to Ring in 2026
summary: The New Year’s Eve celebration drew spectators from around the world, despite cold and blustery weather.

title: Venezuela Detains U.S. Citizens Amid Trump Administration’s Growing Pressure
summary: The number of American citizens held in Venezuela has grown since the start of the U.S. military and economic campaign against President Nicolás Maduro.

title: Most of Iran Shuts Down as Government Grapples With Protests and Economy
summary: Amid mounting street protests, businesses, universities and government offices stayed closed Wednesday under government orders, in 21 of 31 provinces, including Tehran.

title: Suicide Bomber in Syria Kills Security Officer in New Year’s Eve Attack
summary: The attacker likely had links to the Islamic State and was possibly targeting a Christian church in the center of Aleppo, according to a government spokesman.

title: Will the A.I. Boom Continue to Drive Up Stocks in 2026?
summary: The S&P 500 gained 16.4 percent this year. But dependence on artificial intelligence remains a risk for 2026.

title: One Lawyer’s Standoff With Trump’s Deportation Machine
summary: Mahsa Khanbabai’s client, a graduate student, had been whisked away by masked agents and held in lockup for weeks. Would a court free her — and would the government let her go?

title: Tatiana Schlossberg Submitted a Heartbreaking Essay to The New Yorker on Her Cancer Diagnosis, Fully Formed
summary: When Tatiana Schlossberg submitted an essay to The New Yorker, it had not been assigned or even expected. It was accepted immediately and barely edited.

title: Brigitte Bardot’s Legacy of Racist Rhetoric
summary: The actress, who died this week at 91, was an icon of 1960s cinema. She was also a hero to the French far right.

title: Brigitte Bardot Was the Face of a Nation
summary: A star who never played coy for the camera was once an emblem of France.

title: The Top Movies of 2025, According to Times Readers: ‘Marty Supreme’ and More
summary: We asked you to vote on the best films of the year. The results ranged from big box office hits to small art-house indies.

title: A Farewell Ride With the MetroCard, on Every Transit Line That Uses It
summary: Two Times journalists joined Miles Taylor, a YouTuber and transport enthusiast, on a daylong journey across New York City area buses and trains before sale of the card ends on Dec. 31.

title: ‘Swipe, Swipe’: New Yorkers Give the MetroCard a Public Funeral
summary: There were few tears at a funeral for the MetroCard, which included chants of “swipe, swipe” and an urn.

summary: The first episodes of the final season just premiered on Netflix. In interviews, the young stars looked back on the show and how it shaped them.

summary: With a new batch of episodes arriving on Christmas Day, Matt and Ross Duffer discuss the sometimes obscure movie and video game references in the final season so far.

title: The 2025 Politics Yearbook: Most Likely to Be Extreme and Chaotic
summary: How much more chaotic could a second Trump term be? 2025 did not disappoint.

title: There Is a Way Out of This Mess
summary: A second Gilded Age, a single solution.

title: In Chief Justice’s Annual Report, a History Lesson and Embrace of Independence
summary: Chief Justice John G. Roberts Jr. did not directly address the tensions between the Trump administration and federal judges who have blocked the president’s agenda.

title: Manhattan Man, 80, Faces Homicide Charge After Sidewalk Shoving
summary: Dana Escoffier was indicted on a charge of criminally negligent homicide in the death of Dean Whetzel, 82, a neighbor whom he had known for decades.

title: Thieves Make Off With Millions in German Bank Heist
summary: The robbers stole valuables with an insured value of at least $36 million from a bank in Gelsenkirchen, western Germany.

title: Jacqueline de Ribes, Tastemaker and Fashion Avatar, Dies at 96
summary: One of few people in the world of style who could legitimately claim the status of icon, she dressed to impress even before she became a designer.
